description: Sea Surface Temperatures (SSTs) are restored to model climatology plus observed historical anomalies by a Newtonian cooling over the deep tropical eastern Pacific. The restoring timescale is 10 days for a 50m deep mixed layer (or equivalent).  The restoring coefficient of 40 W/m2/K should decrease to zero over an 8 degree buffer zone bounding the restored region.  Monthly SST anomalies (1950-2014) will be provided by DCPP.  Follow the experiment design of Kosaka and Xie (2013).
name: Restore SST Obs Trop E Pacific
rationale: To investigate the role of eastern Pacific sea surface temperatures in the modulation of global surface temperature trends and in driving regional climate variations.
longName: Restore to observed anomalies of SST in the tropical eastern  Pacific
keywords: DCPP, SST, restored, observations, eastern equatorial Pacific
